div.p: This page summarizes the main changes that have happened between releases of the implementation guide

Key changes in this release from the version that went to ballot are below. Where applicable, links are included to the associated Jira issue. In addition to these, a number of other non-substantive changes that clarify or improve wording and/or fix minor errors were applied.

ul.li: Updated CapabilityStatements to be based on US Core and revised conformance expectations for many of the operations. Also added expectations on Patient, Practitioner and other registry resources (FHIR-40796, FHIR-40767, FHIR-40751)

For the different profiles, use 'activity' rather than 'social history' as the category to satisfy US Core and make the Physical Activity category mandatory (FHIR-41295, FHIR-41114, FHIR-41037, FHIR-40776)
For the different observations, remove the prohibition on Observation.bodySite (FHIR-41086)
Added 'patient experience' to the set of activity measures (FHIR-41362)
Added average heart rate as an activity measure (FHIR-40952)
Tightened the condition statuses to those relevant for physical activity (FHIR-41362)
For goal, require at least one of description and target, tighten expectations on Quantity, and allow pointing to any physical activity measure codes (FHIR-41294)
For DiagnosticReport, made the report type extensible (FHIR-41293)
For ServiceRequest, added a 'notes' section, constrained allowed statuses, made authoredOn and requester mandatory, and require either reasonCode or reasonReference (FHIR-41291)
For Task for Referral, made Task.reason, Task.owner and Task.requester 1..1 (FHIR-41295, FHIR-41206)
For RelatedPerson, set conformance expectations for elements in telecom and address (FHIR-41295)
For subscription, change to use the official R4 code (FHIR-41053)

div.p: This was the first version of the specification intended for ballot review. It included the physical activity vital signs, the initial set of time-based and activity-based measures, as well as support for goals, planns, and referral workflow.
